question: What are the names of disaster projects advertised before 2023
raw_answer: Guardrail Replacement Citywide, Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs, Clover Heights Storm Drain
evidence_answer: Clover Heights Storm Drain, Guardrail Replacement Citywide, Broad Beach Road Water Quality Infrastructure Repairs, Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs

Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a
few storm drain on Clover Heights.

The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

There are two
locations within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would
require a vehicle impact protection device.

During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.

The existing storm drain facility ends at
the intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.

few storm drain on Clover Heights.
(cid:190) Updates: Council approved an agreement in December for design services.

The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

The project consists o hiring a consultant to develop
a plan that includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations. (cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Vehicle Protection Devices

(cid:190) Project Description: Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces
located adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area.

There are two
locations within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would
require a vehicle impact protection device.

The existing storm drain facility ends at
the intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.

An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.
(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of this project.

Trancas Canyon Park Slope Stabilization Project (CalJPIA Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of this project.

The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

The existing storm drain facility ends at
the intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.

An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.
